case_vignette: A 52-year-old woman presents with mild epigastric pain and persistent heartburn for the past 2 months. An endoscopy is performed and reveals inflammation of the stomach mucosa without evidence of ulceration. A biopsy is performed and reveals intestinal metaplasia with destruction of a large number of parietal cells. She is diagnosed with chronic atrophic gastritis.
question: Which  is characteristic of this patient’s diagnosis?
correct_ans: destruction of the mucosa of the stomach is mediated by t cells.
